For one who hesitates in awakening, a gentle practice that some scholars considered good is to pray after the Witr (odd-numbered prayer) two rak'ahs sitting on his bed at sleep time. The Sixth: The Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr). Anas bin Malik said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to pray the Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr) after the Evening Prayer (Al-'Isha) with three units (rak'ahs), reciting in the first: 'Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High' (Surah Al-A'la), and in the second: 'Say: O you who disbelieve (Kafirun)' (Surah Al-Kafirun), and in the third: 'Say: He is Allah, the One' (Surah Al-Ikhlas). [225] And it came in the report that he (peace be upon him) used to pray after the Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr) two units (rak'ahs) sitting, and in some of them cross-legged. [226] And in some reports: 'When he intended to enter his bed, he would crawl to it and pray upon it two units (rak'ahs) before lying down, reciting in them: 'When the earth is shaken' (Surah Az-Zalzalah) and Surah At-Takathur.' [227] And in another narration: 'Say: O you who disbelieve (Kafirun).' And it is permissible for the Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr) to be separated and connected with one salutation (taslim) and two salutations (taslimat). And the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prayed the Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr) with one unit (rak'ah) [228], and three [229], and five [230], and thus with the odd-numbered prayers (al-awtar) [231] up to eleven units (rak'ahs) [232]. And the report is uncertain regarding thirteen [233], and in a rare hadith, seventeen units (rak'ahs) [234]. And these units (rak'ahs), I mean what we have named in total as the Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr), are prayer at night, and it is the Night Vigil (At-Tahajjud), and the Night Vigil (At-Tahajjud) at night is a confirmed Sunnah (sunnah mu'akkadah), and mention of its virtues will come in the Book of Invocations (Kitab Al-Awrad). And regarding what is best, there is a difference of opinion. It was said that praying the Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr) with a single unit (rak'ah) is best, since it is confirmed that he (peace be upon him) used to consistently pray the Odd-Numbered Prayer (Al-Witr) with a single unit (rak'ah).
